com.soa.message.handler.script

Interface MessageContext


  • public interface MessageContext

    Represents an message handler context in a scripted environment. A message context provides information about the plaform's message handler framework's processing of a message. From the context you can get information such as the message being processed, the role of the message in a message exchange (IN, OUT, FAULT), and properties that can be changed and read by the chain of handlers that process the message.

    You can gain access to the message being processed as follows: 

        msg = messageContext.getMessage();

    You can gain access to the exchange the message is in as follows: 

        exchange = messageContext.getExchange();

    From there you can get information about the exchange as follows: 

        auditLog.debug("service is " + exchange.getServiceName());
    auditLog.debug("operation is " + exchange.getOperationName());
    auditLog.debug("endpoint is " + exchange.getEndpointName());

    To see if the message in the current context is for the exchange's IN, OUT, or FAULT message: 

        if (messageContext.getParameterType() == 0) { ... }

    A message may be read-only in the current context. If it is read-only a handler must not make changes to it. To see if a message is read-only: 

        isReadOnly = messageContext.isMessageReadOnly();

    A message context can have properties associated with it that all handlers in the chain have access to. A property can be any type of Java object identified by a unique string name. You can access a message context's property as follows: 

        prop1 = messageContext.getProperty("prop1");

    You can create or change a property with: 

        messageContext.setProperty("prop1", "myPropertyValue");

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Exchange getExchange()
      Returns the exchange the message is part of.
      Message getMessage()
      Returns the message.
      java.lang.String getMessageName()
      Returns the name of the message as defined in WSDL.
      int getParameterType()
      Returns the type of message.
      java.lang.Object getProperty(java.lang.String name)
      Returns the property with the given name.
      java.util.Set getPropertyNames()
      Returns the names of the properties associated with the context.

      Returns whether the message in the context is read-only or can be modified.
      void setMessage(Message msg)
      Changes the message in the context.
      void setProperty(java.lang.String name, java.lang.Object property)
      Adds or replaces a property.

    • Method Detail

      • getProperty

        @MethodParameters(parameterNames="name")
java.lang.Object getProperty(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the property with the given name.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the property.
        Returns:
        Object holding the value of the requested property, null if none found.

      • setProperty

        @MethodParameters(parameterNames={"name","property"})
void setProperty(java.lang.String name,
                                                                       java.lang.Object property)
        Adds or replaces a property.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the property.
        property - Value of the property.

      • getPropertyNames

        java.util.Set getPropertyNames()
        Returns the names of the properties associated with the context. Changes made to the Set are reflected in the context, so if a name is removed from the Set, the property is removed from the context. Names cannot be added however.
        Returns:
        Set of String property names.

      • getMessage

        Message getMessage()
        Returns the message.
        Returns:
        Message object.

      • setMessage

        @MethodParameters(parameterNames="msg")
void setMessage(Message msg)
        Changes the message in the context.
        Parameters:
        msg - Message part of the context.

      • getExchange

        Exchange getExchange()
        Returns the exchange the message is part of.
        Returns:
        Exchange holding information about the exchange.

      • getParameterType

        int getParameterType()
        Returns the type of message.
        Returns:
        ParameterType of the message, 0 indicates the IN message, 1 indicates the OUT message, and 2 indicates the FAULT message.

      • getMessageName

        java.lang.String getMessageName()
        Returns the name of the message as defined in WSDL. This is an optional property. If the parameter type is IN or OUT, then no message name is required. If the parameter type is FAULT, then a message name is recommended if there are more than one fault defined for the given operation.
        Returns:
        Name of the message, null if not specified.

      • isMessageReadOnly

        boolean isMessageReadOnly()
        Returns whether the message in the context is read-only or can be modified. Handlers must not alter a message when read-only.
        Returns:
        True if read-only, false if not.
